A verbose explanation of why we created a “new” tool, which really seems a little pointless because there are already so many tools out there, but we felt like we needed to do better, so there you are, I guess.

Necessity is the mother of Innovation

You need the right tool for the job.

If the right tool doesn't exist, ask a crow to make it.

  • (We'll show you how to do that later.)

Tools

Tools

  • Multiple host environments and platforms
  • Multiple forms of interaction

Leap Motion

  • Graphical Interface (IDE)
  • Command Line (Shell)
  • Magical hand-waving (Magic)
  • Some other sorcery?

As human input technology continues to advance, and needs change, how will our tools bend?

What it does

  • Aids in automation of common development tasks
  • Performs setup of boilerplate code and configuration.
  • Helps you focus on business-centric activities.
  • Write tools once, run in any IDE, and share them.
  • Rapid - application development
  • Extensible - modular tooling.
  • Abstract - user interface design (Shell, GUI, web, more?).
  • Personal - and customizable. Your tools should do what you want.

Recap

JBoss Forge

  • can automate common development tasks
  • allows you to extend it’s behavior
  • with a simple programming model
  • without constraining you to a specific environment
